src:
Aplikasi RENTO Jawara Toyota Fun/Code 2019
03 Nov 2019, 23:21 by Tempo.co, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Tim Ga Chibi dengan aplikasi RENTO berhasil mendapatkan nilai tertinggi kompetisi pemrograman Toyota Fun/Code 2019. Tim ini mendapatkan nilai tertinggi dan mendapatkan hadiah utama senilai Rp 50 juta.
Juara kedua direbut tim NL_Lone yang menciptakan aplikasi DEFINO (Deaf Assistant of Toyota) dan juara ketiga direbut tim Focus AR dengan karya aplikasi IMMERSIVE EDU. Juara kedua dan ketiga masing-masing meraih hadiah sebesar Rp 30 juta dan Rp 20 juta.
Penjurian babak final sekaligus pengumuman pemenang dilakukan di Ancol, Jakarta Utara, Minggu, 3 November 2019. Ketiga tim jawara di atas tampil impresif dalam penjurian dengan menyingkirkan 70 finalis terpilih
Direktur Pemasaran PT Toyota Astra Motor Anton Jimmi Suwandy mengatakan bahwa Toyota Fun/Code 2019 digelar dalam rangka menjawab tantangan zaman menuju era digital.
Ia menilai kegiatan ini dapat memberikan gambaran besarnya potensi sumber daya manusia di Indonesia khususnya di bidang teknologi.
“Harapannya kompetisi seperti ini dapat melahirkan tenaga profesional di bidang teknologi informasi yang sangat dibutuhkan untuk menghadapi tantangan global,” ujar dia di sela-sela penjurian.
Toyota Fun/Code dibuka pada 8 Agustus 2019 di Jakarta. Toyota kemudian melakukan road show ke tiga kota besar yakni Yogyakarta, Bandung, dan Jakarta.
PR Manager Toyota Astra Motor Rouli Sijabat mengatakan bahwa kegiatan ini awalnya hanya menargetkan sebanyak 200 peserta. “Tapi dari data yang masuk (mendaftar) mencapai 775 orang dengan 593 tim,” kata Rouli.
Dari angka itu, lanjut dia, terpilih 200 orang yang tergabung dalam 70 tim. Dari 70 tim ini kemudian disaring menjadi 8 tim yang mempresentasikan karyanya di hadapan juri dan peserta lainnya.
“Ide-idenya banyak dan innovatif, ada yang soal eco driving, monitoring servis mobil Toyota, dan sebagainya,” ujarnya.
Sebagian besar memilih subtema ownership experience dengan komposisi 32 persen, diikuti education dengan 22 persen, value chain & trade in dengan 19 persen, eco driving 18 persen dan disability dengan 9 persen.
text:
RENTO Champion Toyota Fun / Code 2019 application
03 Nov 2019, 23:21 by Tempo.co, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Ga Chibi team with the RENTO application managed to get the highest score in the Toyota Fun / Code 2019 programming competition. This team received the highest score and received the main prize of Rp 50 million.
The second winner was won by the NL_Lone team who created the DEFINO (Deaf Assistant of Toyota) application and the third winner was taken by the Focus AR team with the IMMERSIVE EDU application. The second and third place winners each won prizes of IDR 30 million and IDR 20 million.
The final round of judging as well as the announcement of the winners was held in Ancol, North Jakarta, Sunday, November 3, 2019. The three championship teams above appeared impressive in the judging by removing 70 selected finalists
Marketing Director of PT Toyota Astra Motor Anton Jimmi Suwandy said that the Toyota Fun / Code 2019 was held in order to answer the challenges of the era towards the digital era.
He considered this activity can provide a big picture of the potential of human resources in Indonesia, especially in the field of technology.
"Hopefully this kind of competition can give birth to professionals in the field of information technology that are urgently needed to face global challenges," he said on the sidelines of judging.
Toyota Fun / Code opens on August 8, 2019 in Jakarta. Toyota then held a road show to three major cities namely Yogyakarta, Bandung and Jakarta.
Toyota Astra Motor PR Manager Rouli Sijabat said that this activity initially only targeted 200 participants. "But from the data that came in (registered) it reached 775 people with 593 teams," Rouli said.
From that number, he continued, 200 people were selected from 70 teams. From 70 teams this was then filtered into 8 teams who presented their work in front of the judges and other participants.
"The ideas are many and innovative, some are about eco driving, monitoring Toyota car service, and so on," he said.
Most of them chose ownership experience with 32 percent, followed by education with 22 percent, value chain & trade in with 19 percent, eco driving 18 percent and disability with 9 percent.
